original: Dīgha Nikāya 24
analyzed: dīgha nikāya
translated: Long Discourses

original: Pāthikasutta
analyzed: pāthika sutta
translated: With Pāṭikaputta

original: 1. Sunakkhattavatthu
analyzed: su nakkhattavatthu
translated: The Story of Sunakkhatta

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā mallesu viharati anupiyaṁ nāma mallānaṁ nigamo.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā mallesu viharati anupiyam nāma mallānam nigamaḥ
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling among the Mallas at Anupiya.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya anupiyaṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya anupiyam piṇḍāya pāvisi
translated: Then, in the morning, the Blessed One dressed and, taking bowl and robe, entered Anupiya for alms.

original: Atha kho bhagavato etadahosi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavataḥ
translated: Then it occurred to him:

original: “atippago kho tāva anupiyāyaṁ piṇḍāya carituṁ.
analyzed: atippago kho tāva anupiyāyam piṇḍāya caritu
translated: “It’s too early to wander for alms in Anupiya.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ yena bhaggavagottassa paribbājakassa ārāmo, yena bhaggavagotto paribbājako tenupasaṅkameyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham yena bhaggava gottassa paribbājakassa ārāmaḥ yena bhaggava gottaḥ paribbājako tena upasaṅkameyyanti
translated: Suppose I went to the park of the wanderer Bhaggava’s clan and visited the wanderer Bhaggava.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā yena bhaggavagottassa paribbājakassa ārāmo, yena bhaggavagotto paribbājako tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā yena bhaggava gottassa paribbājakassa ārāmaḥ yena bhaggava gottaḥ paribbājako tena upasaṅkami
translated: So he went to the park of the wanderer Bhaggava’s clan and visited the wanderer Bhaggava.

original: Atha kho bhaggavagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho bhaggava gottaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: The wanderer Bhaggava said to him:

original: “etu kho, bhante, bhagavā.
analyzed: etu kho bhante bhagavā
translated: “Come, Blessed One!

original: Svāgataṁ, bhante, bhagavato.
analyzed: svāgata bhante bhagavato
translated: Welcome, Blessed One!

original: Cirassaṁ kho, bhante, bhagavā imaṁ pariyāyamakāsi yadidaṁ idhāgamanāya.
analyzed: cirassam kho bhante bhagavā imam pariyāyam akāsi yat idam idha āgamanāya
translated: It’s been a long time since you took the opportunity to come here.

original: Nisīdatu, bhante, bhagavā, idamāsanaṁ paññattan”ti.
analyzed: nisīdatu bhante bhagavā idam āsanam paññattanti
translated: Please sit down, Lord, a seat is prepared.”

original: Nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane.
analyzed: nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane
translated: The Lord sat down on the prepared seat,

original: Bhaggavagottopi kho paribbājako aññataraṁ nīcaṁ āsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: bhaggava gottaḥ api kho paribbājakaḥ aññataram nīcam āsanam gahetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: and the wanderer Bhaggava took a low seat, sat down at one side

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho bhaggavagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu bhaggava gottaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said to the Lord:

original: “purimāni, bhante, divasāni purimatarāni sunakkhatto licchaviputto yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: purimāni bhante divasāni purimatarāni sunakkhattaḥ licchavi puttaḥ yena aham tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā mama etat avoca
translated: “Lord, a few days ago Sunakkhatta came to me and said:

original: ‘paccakkhāto dāni mayā, bhaggava, bhagavā.
analyzed: paccakkhātaḥ dāni mayā bhaggava bhagavā
translated: ‘Bhaggava, I have renounced my claim to the Lord.

original: Na dānāhaṁ bhagavantaṁ uddissa viharāmī’ti.
analyzed: na dāna aham bhagavantam uddissa viharāmi iti
translated: I no longer live in dependence on the Lord.’

original: Kaccetaṁ, bhante, tatheva, yathā sunakkhatto licchaviputto avacā”ti?
analyzed: kacceta bhante tathā iva yathā sunakkhatto licchavi putto avacāti
translated: Is it true, Lord, that Sunakkhatta has renounced his claim to you?”

original: “Tatheva kho etaṁ, bhaggava, yathā sunakkhatto licchaviputto avaca.
analyzed: tathā iva kho eta bhaggava yathā sunakkhattaḥ licchavi puttaḥ avaca
translated: “Yes, Bhaggava, it is true that Sunakkhatta has renounced his claim to me.

original: Purimāni, bhaggava, divasāni purimatarāni sunakkhatto licchaviputto yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami;
analyzed: purimāni bhaggava divasāni purimatarāni sunakkhattaḥ licchavi puttaḥ yena aham tena upasaṅkami
translated: A few days ago Sunakkhatta came to me and said:

original: upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho, bhaggava,
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā mam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho bhaggava
translated: and after paying homage to me, he sat down to one side.

original: sunakkhatto licchaviputto maṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sunakkhattaḥ licchavi puttaḥ mam etat avoca
translated: Sunakkhatta then said to me:

original: ‘paccakkhāmi dānāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ.
analyzed: paccakkhāmi bhante bhagavanta
translated: ‘Venerable Sir, I renounce the Buddha,

original: Na dānāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ uddissa viharissāmī’ti.
analyzed: na dāna āha bhante bhagavantam uddissa viharissāmi iti
translated: I will no longer live the spiritual life under the Lord.’

original: Evaṁ vutte, ahaṁ, bhaggava, sunakkhattaṁ licchaviputtaṁ etadavocaṁ:
analyzed: evam vutte aha bhaggava sunakkhattam licchavi puttam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, I said to Sunakkhatta:

original: ‘api nu tāhaṁ, sunakkhatta, evaṁ avacaṁ,
analyzed: api nu tā aha su nakkhatta evam avaca
translated: ‘Sunakkhatta, did I ever say to you:

original: ehi tvaṁ, sunakkhatta, mamaṁ uddissa viharāhī’ti?
analyzed: ehi tva su nakkhatta mamaṃ uddissa viharāhi iti
translated: “Come, Sunakkhatta, live the spiritual life under me”?

original: ‘No hetaṁ, bhante’.
analyzed: naḥ heta bhante
translated: ‘No, Venerable Sir.’

original: ‘Tvaṁ vā pana maṁ evaṁ avaca—
analyzed: tvam vā pana mam evam avaca
translated: ‘Or did you ever say to me:

original: ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ uddissa viharissāmī’ti?
analyzed: aha bhante bhagavantam uddissa viharissāmi iti
translated: “I will live the spiritual life under the Lord”?

original: ‘No hetaṁ, bhante’.
analyzed: naḥ heta bhante
translated: ‘No, Venerable Sir.’

original: ‘Iti kira, sunakkhatta, nevāhaṁ taṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: iti kira sunakkhatta na iva aham tam vadāmi
translated: ‘So, Sunakkhatta, it seems that neither did I say to you:

original: ehi tvaṁ, sunakkhatta, mamaṁ uddissa viharāhīti.
analyzed: ehi tva su nakkhatta mamaṃ uddissa viharāhi iti
translated: “Come, Sunakkhatta, live the spiritual life under me”,

original: Napi kira maṁ tvaṁ vadesi—
analyzed: na pi kira mama tvam vadesi
translated: nor did you say to me:

original: ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ uddissa viharissāmīti.
analyzed: aha bhante bhagavantam uddissa viharissāmi iti
translated: “I will live the spiritual life under the Lord”.

original: Evaṁ sante, moghapurisa, ko santo kaṁ paccācikkhasi?
analyzed: evam sante moghapurisa kaḥ santaḥ kam paccācikkhasi
translated: If that’s the case, you foolish man, who are you to dispute with me?

original: Passa, moghapurisa, yāvañca te idaṁ aparaddhan’ti.
analyzed: passa mogha purisa yāvat ca te idam aparaddhanti
translated: See how far you have strayed into error!”

original: ‘Na hi pana me, bhante, bhagavā uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karotī’ti.
analyzed: na hi pana me bhante bhagavā uttari manussa dhammā iddhi pāṭihāriyam karoti iti
translated: ‘But, Sir, you don’t perform any superhuman feat, any demonstration of psychic power.’

original: ‘Api nu tāhaṁ, sunakkhatta, evaṁ avacaṁ—
analyzed: api nu tā aha su nakkhatta evam avaca
translated: ‘But, Sunakkhatta, did I ever say to you:

original: ehi tvaṁ, sunakkhatta, mamaṁ uddissa viharāhi, ahaṁ te uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karissāmī’ti?
analyzed: ehi tva sunakkhatta uddissa viharāhi aham te uttari manussa dhammā iddhi pāṭihāriyam karissāmi iti
translated: “Come and follow me, and I’ll show you a superhuman feat, a demonstration of psychic power”?

original: ‘No hetaṁ, bhante’.
analyzed: naḥ heta bhante
translated: ‘No, Sir.’

original: ‘Tvaṁ vā pana maṁ evaṁ avaca—
analyzed: tvam vā pana mam evam avaca
translated: ‘Or did you ever say to me:

original: ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ uddissa viharissāmi, bhagavā me uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karissatī’ti?
analyzed: aha bhante bhagavantam uddissa viharissāmi bhagavā me uttari manussa dhammā iddhi pāṭihāriyam karissati iti
translated: “I’ll follow you, Sir, and you’ll show me a superhuman feat, a demonstration of psychic power”?

original: ‘No hetaṁ, bhante’.
analyzed: naḥ heta bhante
translated: ‘No, Sir.’

original: ‘Iti kira, sunakkhatta, nevāhaṁ taṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: iti kira sunakkhatta na iva aham tam vadāmi
translated: ‘So, Sunakkhatta, I never said to you:

original: ehi tvaṁ, sunakkhatta, mamaṁ uddissa viharāhi, ahaṁ te uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karissāmīti;
analyzed: ehi tva sunakkhatta uddissa viharāhi aham te uttari manussa dhammā iddhi pāṭihāriyam karissāmi iti
translated: “Come and follow me, and I’ll show you a superhuman feat, a demonstration of psychic power”,

original: napi kira maṁ tvaṁ vadesi—
analyzed: na pi kira mama tvam vadesi
translated: nor did you say to me:

original: ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ uddissa viharissāmi, bhagavā me uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karissatīti.
analyzed: aha bhante bhagavantam uddissa viharissāmi bhagavā me uttari manussa dhammā iddhi pāṭihāriyam karissati iti
translated: I will live devoted to the Buddha, and the Buddha will perform a miracle of supernormal power for me.’

original: Evaṁ sante, moghapurisa, ko santo kaṁ paccācikkhasi?
analyzed: evam sante moghapurisa kaḥ santaḥ kam paccācikkhasi
translated: If that’s the case, foolish man, who are you to dispute with me?

original: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, sunakkhatta,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi sunakkhatta
translated: What do you think, Sunakkhatta?

original: kate vā uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriye akate vā uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriye yassatthāya mayā dhammo desito so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāyā’ti?
analyzed: kate vā uttari manussa dhammāḥ iddhi pāṭihāriye akate vā uttari manussa dhammāḥ iddhi pāṭihāriye yassa atthāya mayā dhammo desito saḥ niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkha kkhayāya ati
translated: Whether a miracle of supernormal power has been performed or not, does my teaching of the Teaching lead to the goal of going beyond all destinations, to the state of wanting nothing, to the complete ending of suffering?”

original: ‘Kate vā, bhante, uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriye akate vā uttari manussadhammā
analyzed: kate vā bhante uttari manussa dhammā iddhipāṭihāriye akate vā uttari manussa dhammā
translated: “Whether a miracle of supernormal power has been performed or not, Master Gotama,

original: iddhipāṭihāriye yassatthāya bhagavatā dhammo desito so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāyā’ti.
analyzed: iddhi pāṭihāriye yassa atthāya bhagavatā dhammo desito so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkha kkhayāya ati
translated: your teaching of the Teaching leads to the goal of going beyond all destinations, to the state of wanting nothing, to the complete ending of suffering.”

original: ‘Iti kira, sunakkhatta, kate vā uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriye, akate vā uttari
analyzed: iti kira sunakkhatta kate vai uttari manussa dhammāḥ iddhi pāṭihāriye a kate vai uttari
translated: “So, Sunakkhatta, whether a miracle of supernormal power has been performed or not,

analyzed: manussa dhammāḥ iddhi pāṭihāriye yassa atthāya mayā dhammaḥ desito saḥ niyyāti takkarassa
translated: I teach the Dhamma for the purpose of attaining the direct knowledges that are higher than human—

original: sammā dukkhakkhayāya.
analyzed: sammā dukkha kkhayāya
translated: for the complete destruction of suffering.

original: Tatra, sunakkhatta, kiṁ uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ kataṁ karissati?
analyzed: tatra sunakkhatta kim uttari manussa dhammā iddhi pāṭihāriyam katam karissati
translated: What’s the point of performing miracles that are higher than human?

original: Passa, moghapurisa, yāvañca te idaṁ aparaddhan’ti.
analyzed: passa mogha purisa yāvat ca te idam aparaddhanti
translated: See how far you’ve strayed, foolish man!”

analyzed: na hi pana me bhante bhagavā aggaññam paññapeti iti
translated: ‘But, Sir, you don’t explain the beginning of things.’

analyzed: api nu tā aha su nakkhatta evam avaca
translated: ‘But, Sunakkhatta, did I ever say to you

analyzed: ehi tva su nakkhatta uddissa viharāhi aham te aggaññam paññapessāmi iti
translated: “Come and I’ll explain the beginning of things to you”?

original: ‘No hetaṁ, bhante’.
analyzed: naḥ heta bhante
translated: ‘No, Sir.’

original: ‘Tvaṁ vā pana maṁ evaṁ avaca—🔽ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ uddissa viharissāmi, bhagavā me aggaññaṁ paññapessatī’ti?
analyzed: tvam vā pana mam evam avaca  aha bhante bhagavantam uddissa viharissāmi bhagavā me aggaññam paññapessati iti
translated: ‘Or did you ever say to me🔽“Sir, please explain the beginning of things to me”?

original: ‘No hetaṁ, bhante’.
analyzed: naḥ heta bhante
translated: ‘No, Sir.’

original: ‘Iti kira, sunakkhatta, nevāhaṁ taṁ vadāmi—🔽ehi tvaṁ, sunakkhatta, mamaṁ uddissa viharāhi, ahaṁ te aggaññaṁ paññapessāmīti.
analyzed: iti kira sunakkhatta na iva aham tam vadāmi 🔽ehi tva su nakkhatta uddissa viharāhi aham te aggaññam paññapessāmi iti
translated: ‘So, Sunakkhatta, neither did I say to you🔽“Come and I’ll explain the beginning of things to you”,

original: Napi kira maṁ tvaṁ vadesi—
analyzed: na pi kira mama tvam vadesi
translated: And you never said to me:

analyzed: aha bhante bhagavantam uddissa viharissāmi bhagavā me aggaññam paññapessati iti
translated: ‘I will live for the benefit of the Sangha, and the Buddha will proclaim my supreme confidence.’

original: Evaṁ sante, moghapurisa, ko santo kaṁ paccācikkhasi?
analyzed: evam sante moghapurisa kaḥ santaḥ kam paccācikkhasi
translated: So, foolish man, who are you to contradict me?

analyzed: tam kim maññasi sunakkhatta
translated: What do you think, Sunakkhatta?

analyzed: paññatte vā aggaññe a paññatte vā aggaññe yassa atthāya mayā dhammo desito saḥ niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkha kkhayāya ati
translated: Whether or not a beginning is declared, is the purpose for which I teach the Dhamma fulfilled, namely, the complete destruction of suffering?”

original: ‘Paññatte vā, bhante, aggaññe, apaññatte vā aggaññe, yassatthāya bhagavatā dhammo desito, so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāyā’ti.
analyzed: paññatte vā bhante aggaññe a paññatte vā aggaññe yassa atthāya bhagavatā dhammo desito so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkha kkhayāya ati
translated: “Whether or not a beginning is declared, Venerable Sir, the purpose for which the Buddha teaches the Dhamma is fulfilled, namely, the complete destruction of suffering.”

original: ‘Iti kira, sunakkhatta, paññatte vā aggaññe, apaññatte vā aggaññe, yassatthāya mayā dhammo desito, so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāya.
analyzed: iti kira sunakkhatta paññatte vā aggaññe a paññatte vā aggaññe yassa atthāya mayā dhammo desito saḥ niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkha kkhayāya
translated: “So, Sunakkhatta, whether or not a beginning is declared, the purpose for which I teach the Dhamma is fulfilled, namely, the complete destruction of suffering.

original: Tatra, sunakkhatta, kiṁ aggaññaṁ paññattaṁ karissati?
analyzed: tatra sunakkhatta kim aggaññam paññattam karissati
translated: So what’s the point of declaring a beginning?

original: Passa, moghapurisa, yāvañca te idaṁ aparaddhaṁ.
analyzed: passa mogha purisa yāvat ca te idam aparaddha
translated: Foolish man, you’ve made a serious slip.

original: Anekapariyāyena kho te, sunakkhatta, mama vaṇṇo bhāsito vajjigāme—
analyzed: aneka pariyāyena kho te sunakkhatta mama vaṇṇaḥ bhāsitaḥ vat jigāme
translated: In many ways you have praised me in the village of the Vajjis,

original: itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavāti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: saying: ‘This Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Well-Farer, a knower of the cosmos, an unexcelled trainer of those people fit to be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.’

original: Iti kho te, sunakkhatta, anekapariyāyena mama vaṇṇo bhāsito vajjigāme.
analyzed: iti kho te sunakkhatta aneka pariyāyena mama vaṇṇaḥ bhāsitaḥ vat jigāme
translated: In many ways you have praised me in the village of the Vajjis.

original: Anekapariyāyena kho te, sunakkhatta, dhammassa vaṇṇo bhāsito vajjigāme—
analyzed: aneka pariyāyena kho te sunakkhatta dhammassa vaṇṇaḥ bhāsitaḥ vajjigāme
translated: In many ways you have praised the Teaching in the village of the Vajjis,

original: svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhīti.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammaḥ sandiṭṭhikaḥ akālikaḥ ehipassikaḥ opaneyyikaḥ paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi iti
translated: saying: ‘The Teaching is well explained by the Buddha, to be seen here and now, timeless, inviting inspection, pertinent, to be experienced by the observant for themselves.’

original: Iti kho te, sunakkhatta, anekapariyāyena dhammassa vaṇṇo bhāsito vajjigāme.
analyzed: iti kho te sunakkhatta aneka pariyāyena dhammassa vaṇṇaḥ bhāsitaḥ vajjigāme
translated: In many ways you have praised the Teaching in the village of the Vajjis.

original: Anekapariyāyena kho te, sunakkhatta, saṅghassa vaṇṇo bhāsito vajjigāme—
analyzed: aneka pariyāyena kho te sunakkhatta saṅghassa vaṇṇaḥ bhāsitaḥ vat jigāme
translated: In many ways you have praised the Saṅgha in the village of the Vajjis,

original: suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ujuppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ñāyappaṭipanno
analyzed: suppaṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ uju ppaṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ ñāya ppaṭipannaḥ
translated: saying: ‘The Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples is practicing well …

original: bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, sāmīcippaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, yadidaṁ cattāri🔽purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā, esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo
analyzed: bhagavato sāvaka saṅgho sāmīcippaṭipannaḥ bhagavato sāvaka saṅghaḥ yat idam cattāri  purisa yugāni aṭṭha purisa puggalā esa bhagavato sāvaka saṅghaḥ āhuneyyaḥ pāhuneyyaḥ
translated: the community of disciples is practising well, the community of disciples is practising the good way, the community of disciples is practising the straight way, the community of disciples is practising the true way, the community of disciples has the practice that is in accordance with the Dhamma, and that leads to complete release—

translated: I declare to you, Sunakkhatta, I make it known to you,

translated: ‘But, Lord, why do you say this to me?

translated: When he dies, he will reappear in the lower realms, in an inauspicious, evil destination, in hell.

analyzed: kālaṅkataḥ ca kālakañcikāḥ nāma asurā sabba nihīnaḥ asura kāyaḥ tatra upapajjissati  kālaṅkatam ca nam bīraṇatthambake susāne chaḍḍessanti iti
translated: When he dies he will reappear in the lowest of the hells.🔽And when he is dead, they will throw him out in the charnel-ground.”

translated: Bhaggava, Sunakkhatta heard that

translated: ‘Do you know, friend Korakkhattiya, where you’ve been reborn?’

translated: ‘What do you think, Sunakkhatta?

original: ‘saccaṁ kira tumhe āyasmanto issarakuttaṁ brahmakuttaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?
analyzed: saccam kira tumhe āyasmantaḥ issarakuttam brahmakuttam ācariyakam aggaññam paññapetha ati
translated: ‘Is it true that you Sirs proclaim a doctrine of creation by an Overlord, creation by Brahmā? ’

original: Te ca me evaṁ puṭṭhā, ‘āmo’ti paṭijānanti.
analyzed: te ca me evam puṭṭhāḥ paṭijānanti
translated: When I had asked this, they admitted that they did.

original: Tyāhaṁ evaṁ vadāmi:
analyzed: tya aham evam vadāmi
translated: I said:

original: ‘kathaṁvihitakaṁ pana tumhe āyasmanto issarakuttaṁ brahmakuttaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?🔽Te mayā puṭṭhā na sampāyanti, asampāyantā mamaññeva paṭipucchanti.
analyzed: kathavihitakam pana tumhe āyasmanto issarakuttam brahmakuttam ācariyakam aggaññam paññapetha ati  te mayā puṭṭhāḥ na sampāyanti a sampāyantāḥ mamaññā iva paṭipucchanti
translated: ‘But how do you proclaim a doctrine of creation by an Overlord, creation by Brahmā? ’🔽When I had asked this, they were unable to reply, and asked me in return to explain the matter.

original: Tesāhaṁ puṭṭho byākaromi:
analyzed: puṭṭhaḥ byākaromi
translated: I replied:

original: ‘Hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṁ kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhuno accayena ayaṁ loko saṁvaṭṭati.
analyzed: hoti kho saḥ āvuso samayaḥ yam kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhunaḥ accayena ayam lokaḥ
translated: ‘There comes a time, friends, sooner or later after a long period, when this world begins to expand again.

original: Saṁvaṭṭamāne loke yebhuyyena sattā ābhassarasaṁvattanikā honti.
analyzed: sa vaṭṭamāne loke yebhuyyena sattāḥ ābhassarasavattanikāḥ honti
translated: When this happens, most beings are reborn in the World of Radiance.

original: Te tattha honti manomayā pītibhakkhā sayaṁpabhā antalikkhacarā subhaṭṭhāyino ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ tiṭṭhanti.
analyzed: te tattha honti manaḥ mayāḥ pīti bhakkhāḥ saya pabhāḥ antalikkha carāḥ subha ṭṭhāyinaḥ ciram dīgham addhānam tiṭṭhanti
translated: They live on for a very long time feeding on rapture.

original: Hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṁ kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhuno accayena ayaṁ loko vivaṭṭati.
analyzed: hoti kho saḥ āvuso samayaḥ yam kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhunaḥ accayena ayam lokaḥ vivaṭṭati
translated: “There comes a time, friends, when after a long period of time this world begins to expand again.

original: Vivaṭṭamāne loke suññaṁ brahmavimānaṁ pātubhavati.
analyzed: vivaṭṭamāne loke suññam brahmavimānam pātubhavati
translated: When the world is expanding, an empty divine palace appears in the space between the worlds.

original: Atha kho aññataro satto āyukkhayā vā puññakkhayā vā ābhassarakāyā cavitvā suññaṁ brahmavimānaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: atha kho aññataraḥ sattaḥ āyu khayā vā puñña khayā vā ābhassara kāyā cavitvā suññam brahmavimānam upapajjati
translated: Then a certain being, through the exhaustion of his life-span or the exhaustion of his merit, passes away from the Ābhassara plane and re-arises in that empty divine palace.

original: So tattha hoti manomayo pītibhakkho sayampabho antalikkhacaro subhaṭṭhāyī, ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: saḥ tattha hoti manaḥ mayaḥ pīti bhakkho sayampabhaḥ antalikkha caraḥ subha ṭṭhāyī ciram dīgham addhānam tiṭṭhati
translated: He is mind-made, feeding on rapture, self-luminous, moving through the air, abiding in glory.

original: Tassa tattha ekakassa dīgharattaṁ nivusitattā anabhirati paritassanā uppajjati—
analyzed: tassa tattha ekakassa dīgharattam nivusita ttā an abhirati paritassanā uppajjati
translated: But after a long time, because of living alone, a sense of loneliness arises in him.

original: aho vata aññepi sattā itthattaṁ āgaccheyyunti.
analyzed: aho vata aññe pi sattāḥ itthattam āgaccheyyunti
translated: He thinks: ‘Oh, that other beings might come here!’

original: Atha aññepi sattā āyukkhayā vā puññakkhayā vā ābhassarakāyā cavitvā suññaṁ brahmavimānaṁ upapajjanti tassa sattassa sahabyataṁ.
analyzed: atha aññe pi sattā āyu khayā vā puñña khayā vā ābhassara kāyā cavitvā suññam brahmavimānam upapajjanti tassa sattassa
translated: Then other beings, as their life-span was ending, passed away from the Ābhassara plane and were reborn in the Brahma-world in that empty mansion.

original: Tepi tattha honti manomayā pītibhakkhā sayaṁpabhā antalikkhacarā subhaṭṭhāyino, ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ tiṭṭhanti.
analyzed: te api tattha honti manaḥ mayāḥ pīti bhakkhāḥ saya pabhāḥ antalikkha carāḥ subha ṭṭhāyinaḥ ciram dīgham addhānam tiṭṭhanti
translated: There they were mind-made, feeding on rapture, self-luminous, moving through the air, abiding in glory. They remained thus for a very long time.

original: Tatrāvuso, yo so satto paṭhamaṁ upapanno, tassa evaṁ hoti—
analyzed: tatra āvuso yaḥ saḥ sattaḥ paṭhamam upapannaḥ tassa evam hoti
translated: “Now, friend, the being who was reborn there first thought:

original: ahamasmi brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānaṁ, mayā ime sattā nimmitā.
analyzed: aham asmi brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūtaḥ aññadatthudasaḥ vasavattī issaraḥ kattā nimmātā seṭṭhaḥ sajitā vasī pitā bhūta bhabyāna mayā ime sattā nimmitā
translated: ‘I am Brahma, the Great Brahma, the Conqueror, the Unconquered, the All-Seeing, the All-Powerful, the Lord, the Maker and Creator, Ruler, Appointer and Orderer, Father of All That Have Been and Shall Be. These beings were created by me.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?🔽Mamañhi pubbe etadahosi—
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu  maman hi pubbe etat ahosi
translated: Why is that?

original: aho vata aññepi sattā itthattaṁ āgaccheyyunti;
analyzed: aho vata aññe pi sattāḥ itthattam āgaccheyyunti
translated: Because I thought: “Oh, that other beings might come to this place!”

original: iti mama ca manopaṇidhi. Ime ca sattā itthattaṁ āgatāti.
analyzed: iti mama ca manaḥ upaṇidhi ime ca sattāḥ itthattam āgatā ati
translated: And so it was that I thought thus, and these beings have come here.’

original: Yepi te sattā pacchā upapannā, tesampi evaṁ hoti—
analyzed: ye pi te sattā pacchā upapannā tesam pi evam hoti
translated: “Then the beings who were reborn there afterwards thought:

original: ayaṁ kho bhavaṁ brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānaṁ;
analyzed: ayam kho bhavam brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūtaḥ vasavattī issaraḥ kattā nimmātā seṭṭhaḥ sajitā vasī pitā bhūta bhabyāna
translated: This Blessed One is Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, the Vanquisher, the Unvanquished, the Universal Seer, the Wielder of Power, the Lord, the Maker and Creator, the Supreme Being, the Ordainer, the Father of All That Breathes, the Master, the Ruler, the Supreme Master of All That Is.

original: iminā mayaṁ bhotā brahmunā nimmitā.
analyzed: iminā mayam bhotā brahmunā nimmitā
translated: We were created by this Blessed One.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Imañhi mayaṁ addasāma idha paṭhamaṁ upapannaṁ; mayaṁ panāmha pacchā upapannāti.
analyzed: iman hi mayam addasāma idha paṭhamam upapanna mayam panāmha pacchā upapannā iti
translated: We saw him first being reborn here, and we were reborn later.

original: Tatrāvuso, yo so satto paṭhamaṁ upapanno, so dīghāyukataro ca hoti vaṇṇavantataro ca mahesakkhataro ca.
analyzed: tatra āvuso yaḥ saḥ satto paṭhamam upapanno saḥ dīghāyukataraḥ ca hoti vaṇṇavantataraḥ ca mahesakkhataraḥ ca
translated: And the being who was reborn first has greater longevity, beauty, well-being, influence, and dominion.

original: Ye pana te sattā pacchā upapannā, te appāyukatarā ca honti dubbaṇṇatarā ca appesakkhatarā ca.
analyzed: ye pana te sattā pacchā upapannā te appāyukatarā ca honti dubbaṇṇatarā ca appesakkhatarā ca
translated: But the beings who were reborn later have less longevity, beauty, well-being, influence, and dominion.

original: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, āvuso, vijjati, yaṁ aññataro satto tamhā kāyā cavitvā itthattaṁ āgacchati.
analyzed: ṭhānam kho pana itas āvuso vijjati yam aññataraḥ satto tamhā kāyā cavitvā itthattam āgacchati
translated: It’s possible that one of those beings, passing away from that state, is reborn in this world.

original: Itthattaṁ āgato samāno agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati.
analyzed: itthattam āgataḥ samānaḥ agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajati
translated: Having been reborn in this world, he goes forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: Agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito samāno ātappamanvāya padhānamanvāya anuyogamanvāya
analyzed: agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ samānaḥ ātappam anvāya padhānam anvāya anuyogam anvāya
translated: And by dint of practice, cultivation, and development of his mind, he realizes with his own insight the supreme end of the spiritual life for the sake of which clansmen rightly go forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: appamādamanvāya sammāmanasikāramanvāya tathārūpaṁ cetosamādhiṁ phusati, yathāsamāhite
analyzed: appamādam anvāya sammāmanasikāram anvāya tathārūpam cetaḥ samādhim phusati yathā samāhite
translated: by diligence, by heedfulness, by striving, by endeavour, by exertion, by carefulness, by concentration of mind, by right attention, he attains such concentration of mind that he recalls his many past lives,

original: citte taṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati; tato paraṁ nānussarati.
analyzed: citte tam pubbenivāsam anussarati tatas param na anussarati
translated: with features and details. But he does not recall his last rebirth.

original: So evamāha:🔽“yo kho so bhavaṁ brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī
analyzed: sā u evam āha  yaḥ kho saḥ bhavam brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū an abhibhūtaḥ vasavattī
translated: He says thus:

original: issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānaṁ, yena mayaṁ bhotā brahmunā
analyzed: issaraḥ kattā nimmātā seṭṭhaḥ sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyāna yena mayam bhotā brahmunā
translated: ‘That Blessed One is Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, the Undefiled, the All-Seeing, the All-Powerful, the All-Ruler, the Sire of all that are and are to be, the Controller, the Maker, the Creator, the Supreme Ordainer. We were created by that Blessed One.

original: nimmitā. So nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṁ tatheva ṭhassati.
analyzed: so niccaḥ dhuvaḥ sassataḥ a vipariṇāma dhammo sassati samam tathā iva
translated: He is permanent, stable, eternal, not subject to change, and he will remain the same just like eternity itself.

original: Ye pana mayaṁ ahumhā tena bhotā brahmunā nimmitā, te mayaṁ aniccā addhuvā appāyukā cavanadhammā itthattaṁ āgatā”ti.
analyzed: ye pana mayam ahumhā tena bhotā brahmunā nimmitā te mayam aniccāḥ addhuvāḥ appāyukā cavana dhammāḥ itthattam āgatā ati
translated: But we who were created by that Blessed One are impermanent, unstable, short-lived, doomed to perish. We have come to this world.’

original: Evaṁvihitakaṁ no tumhe āyasmanto issarakuttaṁ brahmakuttaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti.
analyzed: evavihitakam no tumhe āyasmantaḥ issarakuttam brahmakuttam ācariyakam aggaññam paññapetha ati
translated: So, venerable sirs, you should point out a beginning to the world that is made by a Supreme God, by a Supreme Being, by a Supreme Lord, by a Supreme Ruler, by a Master, by an Overlord.’

original: Te evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: te
translated: They say thus:

original: ‘evaṁ kho no, āvuso gotama, sutaṁ, yathevāyasmā gotamo āhā’ti.
analyzed: evam khalu naḥ āvuso gotama suta yathā iva ayasmai gotamaḥ āha ati
translated: ‘Friend Gotama, that is how we have heard it too.’

original: Aggaññañcāhaṁ, bhaggava, pajānāmi.
analyzed: aggaññañca āha bhaggava pajānāmi
translated: I understand the beginning,

original: Tañca pajānāmi, tato ca uttaritaraṁ pajānāmi, tañca pajānaṁ na parāmasāmi, aparāmasato ca me paccattaññeva nibbuti viditā. Yadabhijānaṁ tathāgato no anayaṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: tat ca pajānāmi tatas ca uttaritaram pajānāmi tat ca pajānam na parāmasāmi a parāmasataḥ ca me paccattaññā iva nibbuti viditā yat abhijānam tathāgataḥ no anayam āpajjati
translated: and I understand what is beyond that. I do not cling to what I understands, and not clinging, I have come to know for myself Nirvana, the end of all the corruptions.

original: Santi, bhaggava, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā khiḍḍāpadosikaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapenti.
analyzed: santi bhaggavaḥ eke samaṇa brāhmaṇā khiḍḍāpadosikam ācariyakam aggaññam paññapenti
translated: There are some ascetics and Brahmins who proclaim a beginning to the world, and do so on four grounds.

original: Tyāhaṁ upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadāmi:
analyzed: tya aham upasaṅkamitvā evam vadāmi
translated: I went to them and said:

original: ‘saccaṁ kira tumhe āyasmanto khiḍḍāpadosikaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?
analyzed: saccam kira tumhe āyasmanto khiḍḍāpadosikam ācariyakam aggaññam paññapetha ati
translated: ‘Is it true that you proclaim a beginning to the world in four ways? ‘

original: Te ca me evaṁ puṭṭhā ‘āmo’ti paṭijānanti.
analyzed: te ca me evam puṭṭhāḥ paṭijānanti
translated: And they admitted that they did.

original: Tyāhaṁ evaṁ vadāmi:
analyzed: tya aham evam vadāmi
translated: I said:

original: ‘kathaṁvihitakaṁ pana tumhe āyasmanto khiḍḍāpadosikaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?
analyzed: kathavihitakam pana tumhe āyasmanto khiḍḍāpadosikam ācariyakam aggaññam paññapetha ati
translated: ‘How do you do that? ‘

original: Te mayā puṭṭhā na sampāyanti, asampāyantā mamaññeva paṭipucchanti,
analyzed: te mayā puṭṭhāḥ na sampāyanti a sampāyantāḥ mamaññā iva paṭipucchanti
translated: But they could not explain it, and they asked me in return.

original: tesāhaṁ puṭṭho byākaromi:
analyzed: puṭṭhaḥ byākaromi
translated: And I explained it to them.

original: ‘Santāvuso, khiḍḍāpadosikā nāma devā. Te ativelaṁ hassakhiḍḍāratidhammasamāpannā
analyzed: santi āvuso khiḍḍāpadosikā nāma devā te ativelam hassa khiḍḍā rati dhamma samāpannā
translated: ‘There are gods called “gods who delight in creation”. They spend too much time amusing themselves with the five kinds of heavenly music.

original: viharanti. Tesaṁ ativelaṁ hassakhiḍḍāratidhammasamāpannānaṁ viharataṁ sati sammussati,
analyzed: viharanti tesam ativelam hassa khiḍḍā rati dhamma samāpannānam viharatam sati sammussati
translated: As a result, their mindfulness decays,

original: satiyā sammosā te devā tamhā kāyā cavanti.
analyzed: satiyā sammosā te devā tamhā kāyā cavanti
translated: and they fall from that heavenly state.

original: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, āvuso, vijjati, yaṁ aññataro satto tamhā kāyā cavitvā itthattaṁ āgacchati,
analyzed: ṭhānam kho pana itas āvuso vijjati yam aññataraḥ satto tamhā kāyā cavitvā itthattam āgacchati
translated: It is possible that a certain being, having fallen from that heavenly state, comes back to this human state.

original: itthattaṁ āgato samāno agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati,🔽agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito samāno ātappamanvāya padhānamanvāya anuyogamanvāya🔽appamādamanvāya sammāmanasikāramanvāya tathārūpaṁ cetosamādhiṁ phusati, yathāsamāhite
analyzed: itthattam āgataḥ samānaḥ agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajati  agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ samānaḥ ātappam anvāya padhānam anvāya anuyogam anvāya  appamādam anvāya sammāmanasikāram anvāya tathārūpam cetaḥ samādhim phusati yathā samāhite
translated: Having come back, he goes forth from the home life into homelessness.🔽By dint of practice, development, and cultivation,🔽he attains such a level of concentration that he touches the deathless element with his body.

original: citte taṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati; tato paraṁ nānussarati.
analyzed: citte tam pubbenivāsam anussarati tatas param na anussarati
translated: With his mind thus concentrated, he recollects his manifold past lives, i.e. one birth, two five, ten fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand, many eons of cosmic contraction, many eons of cosmic expansion, many eons of cosmic contraction and expansion.

original: So evamāha:
analyzed: sā u evam āha
translated: He says:

original: “ye kho te bhonto devā na khiḍḍāpadosikā te na ativelaṁ hassakhiḍḍāratidhammasamāpannā
analyzed: ye kho te bhonto devā na khiḍḍā padosikā te na ativelam hassa khiḍḍā rati dhamma samāpannā
translated: “Those good gods who are not addicted to sexual intercourse

original: viharanti. Tesaṁ nātivelaṁ hassakhiḍḍāratidhammasamāpannānaṁ viharataṁ sati na sammussati,🔽satiyā asammosā te devā tamhā kāyā na cavanti,
analyzed: viharanti tesam na ativelam hassa khiḍḍā rati dhamma samāpannānam viharatam sati na sammussati  satiyā asammosā te devā tamhā kāyā na cavanti
translated: They don’t lose their mindfulness,🔽and they don’t pass away from that state.

original: niccā dhuvā sassatā avipariṇāmadhammā sassatisamaṁ tatheva ṭhassanti.
analyzed: niccā dhuvā sassatā a vipariṇāma dhammā sassati samam tathā iva
translated: They are permanent, stable, eternal, not subject to change, and they will remain the same for all eternity.

original: Ye pana mayaṁ ahumhā khiḍḍāpadosikā te mayaṁ ativelaṁ hassakhiḍḍāratidhammasamāpannā🔽viharimhā, tesaṁ no ativelaṁ hassakhiḍḍāratidhammasamāpannānaṁ viharataṁ sati sammussati,
analyzed: ye pana mayam ahumhā khiḍḍā padosikā te mayam ativelam hassa khiḍḍā rati dhamma samāpannā  viharimhā tesam no ativelam hassa khiḍḍā rati dhamma samāpannānam viharatam sati sammussati
translated: But we, who were addicted to play, spent too much time indulging in play, laughter, and frivolity.🔽We lost our mindfulness,

original: satiyā sammosā evaṁ mayaṁ tamhā kāyā cutā,
analyzed: satiyā sammosā evam mayam tamhā kāyā cutā
translated: and we passed away from that state.

original: aniccā addhuvā appāyukā cavanadhammā itthattaṁ āgatā”ti.
analyzed: aniccā addhuvā appāyukā cavana dhammā itthattam āgatā ati
translated: We are impermanent, unstable, short-lived, subject to death, and we have come to this world.”

original: Evaṁvihitakaṁ no tumhe āyasmanto khiḍḍāpadosikaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti.
analyzed: evavihitakam no tumhe āyasmanto khiḍḍāpadosikam ācariyakam aggaññam paññapetha ati
translated: So, Venerable Sirs, please explain the beginning of things as you see it and as you have learned it from your teachers.’

original: Te evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: te
translated: They replied:

original: ‘evaṁ kho no, āvuso gotama, sutaṁ, yathevāyasmā gotamo āhā’ti.
analyzed: evam khalu naḥ āvuso gotama suta yathā iva ayasmai gotamaḥ āha ati
translated: ‘We have heard this, too, Venerable Gotama, as you have said.’

original: Aggaññañcāhaṁ, bhaggava, pajānāmi …pe…
analyzed: aggaññañca āha bhaggava pajānāmi pe
translated: I know the beginning of things, Bhaggava …

original: yadabhijānaṁ tathāgato no anayaṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: yat abhijānam tathāgataḥ no anayam āpajjati
translated: and the Realised One does not fall into misfortune through what he knows.

original: Santi, bhaggava, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā manopadosikaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapenti.
analyzed: santi bhaggavaḥ eke samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ manopadosikam ācariyakam aggaññam paññapenti
translated: There are some ascetics and brahmins, Bhaggava, who proclaim a doctrine of moral determinism based on what was done in the past.

original: Tyāhaṁ upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadāmi:
analyzed: tya aham upasaṅkamitvā evam vadāmi
translated: I approached them and said:

translated: and because of this the Tathagata is not subject to censure.

original: Santi, bhaggava, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā adhiccasamuppannaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapenti.
analyzed: santi bhaggavaḥ eke samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ adhicca samuppannam ācariyakam aggaññam paññapenti
translated: There are some ascetics and Brahmins who declare that the beginning of things was due to chance.

original: Tyāhaṁ upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadāmi:
analyzed: tya aham upasaṅkamitvā evam vadāmi
translated: I went up to them and said:

original: ‘saccaṁ kira tumhe āyasmanto adhiccasamuppannaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?
analyzed: saccam kira tumhe āyasmantaḥ adhicca samuppannam ācariyakam aggaññam paññapetha ati
translated: ‘Is it true, friends, that you proclaim a doctrine of chance, and that you teach and declare to others a doctrine of chance?’

original: Te ca me evaṁ puṭṭhā ‘āmo’ti paṭijānanti.
analyzed: te ca me evam puṭṭhāḥ paṭijānanti
translated: When I had asked this, they admitted that it was true.

original: Tyāhaṁ evaṁ vadāmi:
analyzed: tya aham evam vadāmi
translated: I said to them:

original: ‘kathaṁvihitakaṁ pana tumhe āyasmanto adhiccasamuppannaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?
analyzed: kathavihitakam pana tumhe āyasmantaḥ adhicca samuppannam ācariyakam aggaññam paññapetha ati
translated: ‘But, friends, how do you proclaim a doctrine of chance?’

original: Te mayā puṭṭhā na sampāyanti, asampāyantā mamaññeva paṭipucchanti.

original: Tesāhaṁ puṭṭho byākaromi:

analyzed: santi āvuso asaññasattāḥ nāma devāḥ
translated: ‘There are, friends, gods called “corrupted by perception”.

original: Saññuppādā ca pana te devā tamhā kāyā cavanti.
analyzed: saññuppādā ca pana te devā tamhā kāyā cavanti
translated: When their perception arises, they fall from that plane.

original: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, āvuso, vijjati yaṁ aññataro satto tamhā kāyā cavitvā itthattaṁ āgacchati.
analyzed: ṭhānam kho pana itas āvuso vijjati yam aññataraḥ satto tamhā kāyā cavitvā itthattam āgacchati
translated: It is possible, friends, that a certain being, falling from that plane, will reappear in this world.

original: Itthattaṁ āgato samāno agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati.
analyzed: itthattam āgataḥ samānaḥ agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajati
translated: Having reappeared here, he goes forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: Agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito samāno ātappamanvāya padhānamanvāya anuyogamanvāya
analyzed: agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ samānaḥ ātappam anvāya padhānam anvāya anuyogam anvāya
translated: Having gone forth, by dint of ardour, endeavour, application, diligence, and right reflection, he attains to such a degree of mental concentration that with his mind thus concentrated he recollects his immediately preceding life, but none previous to that.

original: appamādamanvāya sammāmanasikāramanvāya tathārūpaṁ cetosamādhiṁ phusati, yathāsamāhite
analyzed: appamādam anvāya sammāmanasikāram anvāya tathārūpam cetaḥ samādhim phusati yathā samāhite
translated: by diligence, by heedfulness, by striving, by endeavour, by mental endeavour, by exertion, by right endeavour, he attains that kind of concentration of mind in which he recollects his many kinds of previous existences,

original: citte taṁ saññuppādaṁ anussarati, tato paraṁ nānussarati’.
analyzed: citte tam saññuppādam anussarati tatas param na anussarati
translated: but he does not recollect his last existence.

original: So evamāha:
analyzed: sā u evam āha
translated: He says thus:

original: ‘adhiccasamuppanno attā ca loko ca.
analyzed: adhicca samuppannaḥ attā ca loko ca
translated: ‘The self and the world are accidental.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?🔽Because formerly I did not exist, and now I exist.

original: Ahañhi pubbe nāhosiṁ, somhi etarahi ahutvā santatāya pariṇato’ti.
analyzed: aham hi pubbe na ahosi somhi etarahi a hutvā santatāya pariṇataḥ ti
translated: Having not been, I have come to be.’

original: ‘Evaṁvihitakaṁ no tumhe āyasmanto adhiccasamuppannaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?
analyzed: evavihitakam no tumhe āyasmantaḥ adhicca samuppannam ācariyakam aggaññam paññapetha ati
translated: ‘Is it in this way, Master Bhaggava, that you declare the self and the world to be accidental, as taught by your teacher?’

original: Te evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: te
translated: They replied:

original: ‘evaṁ kho no, āvuso gotama, sutaṁ yathevāyasmā gotamo āhā’ti.
analyzed: evam khalu naḥ āvuso gotama sutam yathā iva ayasmai gotamaḥ āha ati
translated: ‘Yes, friend Gotama.’

original: Aggaññañcāhaṁ, bhaggava, pajānāmi tañca pajānāmi, tato ca uttaritaraṁ pajānāmi, tañca pajānaṁ na parāmasāmi, aparāmasato ca me paccattaññeva nibbuti viditā.
analyzed: aggaññam ca āha bhaggava pajānāmi tat ca pajānāmi tatas ca uttaritaram pajānāmi tat ca pajānam na parāmasāmi a parāmasataḥ ca me paccattaññā iva nibbuti viditā
translated: I understand the beginning of the self and the world, and I understand what transcends it, and I do not cling to what transcends it.

original: Yadabhijānaṁ tathāgato no anayaṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: yat abhijānam tathāgataḥ no anayam āpajjati
translated: When the Tathagata understands thus, he does not take up a position that would lead to his harm.

original: Evaṁvādiṁ kho maṁ, bhaggava, evamakkhāyiṁ eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhanti:
analyzed: eva vādim khalu ma bhaggava evam akkhāyim eke samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ asatā tucchā musā a bhūtena abbhācikkhanti
translated: But some ascetics and brahmins falsely and wrongly assert that I do so.

original: ‘viparīto samaṇo gotamo bhikkhavo ca.
analyzed: viparītaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ bhikkhavaḥ ca
translated: They say: ‘The ascetic Gotama is wrong and mistaken.

original: Samaṇo gotamo evamāha—
analyzed: samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ evam āha
translated: The ascetic Gotama says:

original: yasmiṁ samaye subhaṁ vimokkhaṁ upasampajja viharati, sabbaṁ tasmiṁ samaye asubhantveva pajānātī’ti.
analyzed: yasmin samaye subham vimokkham upasampajja viharati sabbam tasmin samaye asubham tu eva pajānāti iti
translated: “When one abides resolved upon a sign of the beautiful, then only the beautiful is discerned.”🔽But I do not say so.

original: Na kho panāhaṁ, bhaggava, evaṁ vadāmi:🔽‘yasmiṁ samaye subhaṁ vimokkhaṁ upasampajja viharati, sabbaṁ tasmiṁ samaye asubhantveva pajānātī’ti.🔽Evañca khvāhaṁ, bhaggava, vadāmi:
analyzed: na kho pana āha bhaggavaḥ evam vadāmi  yasmin samaye subham vimokkham upasampajja viharati sabbam tasmin samaye asubham tu eva pajānāti iti  evam ca khvā āha bhaggava vadāmi
translated: I say:

original: ‘yasmiṁ samaye subhaṁ vimokkhaṁ upasampajja viharati, subhantveva tasmiṁ samaye pajānātī’”ti.
analyzed: yasmin samaye subham vimokkham upasampajja viharati subham tu eva tasmin samaye pajānāti iti
translated: When one abides resolved upon a sign of the beautiful, then only the beautiful is discerned.’“

original: “Te ca, bhante, viparītā, ye bhagavantaṁ viparītato dahanti bhikkhavo ca.
analyzed: te ca bhante viparītāḥ ye bhagavantam viparītataḥ dahanti bhikkhavaḥ ca
translated: “Venerable sir, those who misrepresent the Blessed One as speaking otherwise than he in fact does, and who misrepresent the Dhamma and the discipline as taught by him, are wrongdoers.

original: Evaṁpasanno ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavati. Pahoti me bhagavā tathā dhammaṁ desetuṁ, yathā ahaṁ subhaṁ vimokkhaṁ upasampajja vihareyyan”ti.
analyzed: eva pasannaḥ aha bhante bhagavati pahoti me bhagavā tathā dhammam desetu yathā aham subham vimokkham upasampajja vihareyyanti
translated: I have confidence in the Blessed One thus: ‘The Blessed One is capable of teaching me the subhādiṭṭhi brahma-world.’

original: “Dukkaraṁ kho etaṁ, bhaggava, tayā aññadiṭṭhikena aññakhantikena aññarucikena aññatrāyogena aññatrācariyakena subhaṁ vimokkhaṁ upasampajja viharituṁ.

translated: “It is difficult, Bhaggava, for you, who have a different view, a different belief, a different preference, a different affection, a different commitment, and a different teacher, to attain the subhādiṭṭhi brahma-world.

original: Iṅgha tvaṁ, bhaggava, yo ca te ayaṁ mayi pasādo, tameva tvaṁ sādhukamanurakkhā”ti.
analyzed: iṅgha tva bhaggava yaḥ ca te ayam mayi pasādaḥ tam eva tvam sādhukam anurakkhāti
translated: So, Bhaggava, you should guard well whatever confidence you have in me.”

original: “Sace taṁ, bhante, mayā dukkaraṁ aññadiṭṭhikena aññakhantikena aññarucikena aññatrāyogena aññatrācariyakena subhaṁ vimokkhaṁ upasampajja viharituṁ.
analyzed: sace bhante mayā dukkaram añña diṭṭhikena añña khantikena añña rucikena aññatra ayogena aññatra ācariyakena subham vimokkham upasampajja viharitu
translated: “If it is difficult for me, venerable sir, who have a different view, a different belief, a different preference, a different affection, a different commitment, and a different teacher, to attain the subhādiṭṭhi brahma-world,

original: Yo ca me ayaṁ, bhante, bhagavati pasādo, tamevāhaṁ sādhukamanurakkhissāmī”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ ca me bhante bhagavati pasādaḥ tam eva aham sādhukam anurakkhissāmi iti
translated: then I will guard well whatever confidence I have in the Blessed One.”

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: This is what the Blessed One said.

original: Attamano bhaggavagotto paribbājako bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandīti.
analyzed: attamanaḥ bhaggavagottaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinandi iti
translated: The wanderer Bhaggava, son of the clan, was satisfied and delighted in the Blessed One’s words.

original: Pāthikasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: pāthika suttam niṭṭhitam paṭhama
translated: The Discourse on Pāṭikaputta is finished.
